title: Isaiah 33:1
text: WOE to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee!  when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.

title: Isaiah 33:2
text: O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

title: Isaiah 33:3
text: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.

title: Isaiah 33:4
text: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.

title: Isaiah 33:5
text: The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.

title: Isaiah 33:6
text: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is his treasure.

title: Isaiah 33:7
text: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.

title: Isaiah 33:8
text: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

title: Isaiah 33:9
text: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness: and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.

title: Isaiah 33:10
text: Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.

title: Isaiah 33:11
text: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.

title: Isaiah 33:12
text: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.

title: Isaiah 33:13
text: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.

title: Isaiah 33:14
text: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites.  Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire?  who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

title: Isaiah 33:15
text: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

title: Isaiah 33:16
text: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.

title: Isaiah 33:17
text: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.

title: Isaiah 33:18
text: Thine heart shall meditate terror.  Where is the scribe?  where is the receiver?  where is he that counted the towers?

title: Isaiah 33:19
text: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.

title: Isaiah 33:20
text: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

title: Isaiah 33:21
text: But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

title: Isaiah 33:22
text: For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us.

title: Isaiah 33:23
text: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

title: Isaiah 33:24
text: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
